snippet.textDisplay:
As a Chinese, we have experienced that for last 2 months and gained some experiences and contained it successfully, although painful. But I found most western media is given incomplete or false information and do not learn from it. So I would like to share with you the 2 most important finding here:
1, Many people do not have symtoms in the first several days when have this virus. So you can not rely on others to wear mask when sick. Because they do not know they are infected.
2, the fatality rate looks not so high only when early infection was treated, when you are in serious situation, it will be too late. So when hospital system destroyed, the fatality rate will be much higher like what happened in Wuhan.


You may choose your behaviour with these 2 points. Stay safe and good luck.

snippet.textDisplay:
time is crucial in this phase, it's mandatory to take drastic measures, everything was experienced here in Italy ten days ago is about to happen in England, you guys have time to take countermeasures, but don't fool yourself with soft measures, the lockdown is the only way to go, you have to cut the chain of spreading, this will give time to the Health Care System to react and don't be overwhelmed by thousands of patients in need of intensive care and auto respiration devices. The school is not a problem, close the schools and Universities, cut every sport events and ban any kind of gatherings. Start a campaign of statistic tests, you need a clear picture of the disease spreading and percentage, you need DATA, data are mandatory to modulate the reaction plan, my country, Italy is a clear example of the rate of spreading. You have to CHOOSE and you have to CHOOSE NOW, tomorrow will be 24 hours lost in the fight, and this is a fight, no this is a war. Our economies guys will be heavily hit, but recovery from a crisis like this is possible only if you put the Pandemic as your first target, anything comes behind, you have to use common sense, there are no more pubs, no more bars, no more clubs, and nightlife...remember there is no vaccine. Here in Italy, especially here in the North, we have the most advanced public health care system in Europe, and still, our Hospitals are facing collapse. If you guys are able to change dramatically your behaviors for the sake of your beloved, you can go through this epochal crisis and recover in a couple months. We are closing all our business in these days in Italy. Bars, restaurants, shops, even the Building industry is closing, at least for the next 3 weeks Italy is in total lockdown and economic shutdown...You have savings, change your perspective about life, the business can wait, life is more important. All of us have to learn a lesson from this pandemic, we are just human being, we are weak, our systems are weak, we are not prepared, even if we try to...but we can learn from our mistakes and make a good decision, now it's your time guys in England MAKE YOUR GOOD DECISION, Glod Blesses ya all stay safe,
Alberto

snippet.textDisplay:
US exhumed victim of Flu and found out it was Corona virus that kill them. So the Japanese suspect of the virus originated in US is not hoax after all Via Emperor

So the US CDC has finally confirmed what we have suspected all along. Some of the so-called flu death in America had in fact been found to be caused by coronavirus posthumously. Just that they didn't know before because they were never tested. That fits in with previous reports in Japan that a Japanese contracted coronavirus in Hawaii even before the Wuhan outbreak and the Italians discovered that a different strain of the virus had already been circulating in Italy before the arrival of Chinese patients.

CDC director says some coronavirus-related deaths have been found posthumously
https://edition.cnn.com/world/live-news/coronavirus-outbreak-03-11-20-intl-hnk/h_1319f66f92245a2fe4ec63fe91ab66c9



During the House Oversight Committee discussion on the novel coronavirus response, the director of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said some deaths from coronavirus have been discovered posthumously.

Rep. Harley Rouda asked CDC director Dr. Robert Redfield if it’s possible that some flu patients may have been misdiagnosed and actually had coronavirus.

"The standard practice is the first thing you do is test for influenza, so if they had influenza they would be positive," Redfield said.

Rouda then asked Redfield if they are doing posthumous testing.

Redfield said there has been "a surveillance system of deaths from pneumonia, that the CDC has; it’s not in every city, every state, every hospital.”

Rouda followed up and asked, “So we could have some people in the United States dying for what appears to be influenza when in fact it could be the coronavirus?”

The doctor replied that “some cases have actually been diagnosed that way in the United States today.”

AND USA LOCK DOWN ON THOSE DETAILS

And now we all know why USA is so secretive about covid19
https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-secrecy-exclusive/exclusive-white-house-told-federal-health-agency-to-classify-coronavirus-deliberations-sources-idUSKBN20Y2LM?fbclid=IwAR2SQ6rZxJqbMt9XaLM1DyuaA5nUrm6DtNshM_O7uzY6Ti1R7Io8lJDLdno

snippet.textDisplay:
Jon Snow and Jeremy Hunt are not medics, far from it. The former should have learned by now not to play politics at every opportunity. The government is taking the best scientific evidence from the people most qualified on which to base their strategy.
The NHS is one of the largest employer of people in Europe (as far as I know) and if schools were shut then thousands of children would end up with their grandparents, the most vulnerable sector of society and the number of NHS staff charged with looking after their own children would place an unimaginable strain on hospitals which would result in catastrophe. Care homes are also staffed with a large staff/resident ratio. There are legions of support and supply people in and out every day who themselves are in multiple contact with other homes and hospitals and all of them are potential carriers. Visits from relations supervised with a hygiene regime pose acceptable risks in the light of the above.
The government are advising old people and those with illness to self isolate in their own homes.
Not banning public events in the outdoors is applying a herd immunity approach where the healthy are able to resist infection or are able to eventually fight off an infection so the country finishes up with an immune population. This way we avoid an unmanageable peak in hospital admissions which we might well get if we apply the lock down scenario.
Hope this helps Jon

snippet.textDisplay:
Jeremy Hunt is scaremongering.

Personally Myself and my Wife are in the at risk group. I will not seek help unless showing symptoms. I believe that government advice is good because no one in this country is immune from this virus and there is no treatment available with no vaccine as yet made.

The logic is that those in the at risk area should take precautions advised, wash hands, stay away from crowded places etc, and with anyone that is showing signs of the virus should self isolate.

Those, even those with symptoms that are otherwise healthy will be fine even if they have the virus.

Those at risk will already have underlying issues, like responsary, Diabetic, Asthma or other health issues around breathing.(Many in this category will need hospital treatment should they get the virus).

The idea that this virus runs its course makes sense because as I have reasoned most of the population is fairly healthy and to get the virus is bit like flu, they will recover with normal isolation when they get signs.

They will not need hospital treatment. After having the virus they will have acquired some immunity and this will help the whole country to get back on its feet.

Kids and normal healthy people will not really be at risk even if they get the infection.

These measures will mean that the infection will peak at a much lower level and so reduce the pressure on the NHS.

snippet.textDisplay: 4 weeks? What is wrong with this PM, trusting quacks instead of medical advice? Protect your people, test anyone who may have it, and enforce measures with strict consequences to those who break the law.. Comparison: the Philippines has now placed the entirety of Metro Manila (a city bigger, more built up, and more dense than Greater London) on lockdown from the 15th, and put the entire country under a code red alert. Forcing social distancing, IDs would be checked for anyone who attempts to travel in or out of Metro Manila, and all schools, unis, and colleges to close. No gatherings above 100 people altogether.. And yet they only have 64 cases in the entire country, and that is with proper reporting and contact-tracing. The UK now has 609 cases! The WHO praised the Philippine govt for their timely measures...yet I don't see anything positive they have said about what the UK government are doing.. The measures each country take are a reflection of the state of mind of those at the helm: leaders who put people's lives first vs 'leaders' who put inanimate cash and economies ahead of human lives..

snippet.textDisplay:
I like the the way he reasons. The meaning and implications of epidemics numbers, and the projection into the future of those numbers, for the capability of the health system to manage them. The assessment of the experience of other countries. The urgency.
He is very right: every day counts, dramatically.
And this is simply in the numbers: epidemics start out with an exponential growth, and because they are exponential in their nature, thinking proportionally and reactively is doomed to fail, to be too little, too late.
You must think anticipating the level of threat that You will face when Your measures will have effect (e.g. due to the delay from infection and the disease expression), and that threat is exponentially greater than what we see today.

snippet.textDisplay:
For once, I actually agree with Jeremy Hunt, and I believe it would be wise for Government and senior science advisors to take his message seriously. If we even have 4 weeks, by choosing not to, you will be putting the public at greater risk.



One would like to believe that as a Nation we would take what has seemed to work from other Countries in their robust approach in tackling containment or delay far more seriously than we're doing. It would be hugely remiss of us, to not heed such advice, or take what maybe seen as drastic measures in order to avoid the NHS going into meltdown over the coming weeks.



Sometimes you have to go with your gut feeling, it's not always about science and it's not always about politics. Yes, they are useful in taking onboard the data presently, but they are not necessary the right answer to the problem at hand.



This is where Leadership is both critical, and most definitely not for the faint-hearted. Yes, you could be seen as unpopular should you go against the voice of the public, but again you could be on a hiding to nothing. History will either remember you favourably as a "Hero" or non-favourably as a "Zero"



Natural Born Leaders are few, and there is good reason for that. They are your least likely, and will only ever rise to the ocassion when push comes to shove, and only then. However when they take command you see instantly why they are the way they are.



Focussed, unwavering, rock solid, and have that aura of confidence, and unshakeableness that they don't see in others. They don't suffer fools lightly, and that is what sets them apart from the rest. When you want the so called "Extraordinary" they will always step up, and it's the "Extra" that makes them so. People who think outside the box, people who can see and extrapolate the locked potential in others.



They will throw those they believe into the crucible of learning not to destroy them but to refine them. That is your "Natural Born Leader" They don't need praise, they don't need adoration, they just need to be followed. It doesn't get easier than that!

snippet.textDisplay:
Dr. John Campbell (UK) - "Flattening the curve", and how to slow down the spread of the virus, from person to person

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OkwHNeNU098

Flattening
the curve means delaying the spread of the virus, so the hospitals and emergency services aren't all hit by it at once.

It's something all of us can be part of, and we can all make a difference.

Dr. John Campbell is a UK health care professional, and a Corona virus expert. On his Youtube channel, you will see more or less daily updates about the virus, as well as medical teaching videos, stretching back about 12 years.

https://www.youtube.com/user/Campbellteaching/videos
